      • create

        public static NumberFormatOptions create()
        Default constructor.
        Returns:
        a new object instance

      • setDecimalSymbol

        public final void setDecimalSymbol(String decimalSymbol)
        A character to use as the decimal marker. The default is a dot (.).
        Parameters:
        decimalSymbol -

      • setFractionDigits

        public final void setFractionDigits(int fractionDigits)
        A number specifying how many digits to display after the decimal. The default is 2. If you specify more digits than the number contains, it will display zeros for the smaller values. Truncated values will be rounded (5 rounded up).
        Parameters:
        fractionDigits -

      • setGroupingSymbol

        public final void setGroupingSymbol(String groupingSymbol)
        A character to be used to group digits to the left of the decimal into sets of three. Default is a comma (,).
        Parameters:
        groupingSymbol -

      • setNegativeColor

        public final void setNegativeColor(String negativeColor)
        The text color for negative values. No default value. Values can be any acceptable HTML color value, such as "red" or "#FF0000".
        Parameters:
        negativeColor -

      • setNegativeParens

        public final void setNegativeParens(boolean negativeParens)
        A boolean, where true indicates that negative values should be surrounded by parentheses. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        negativeParens -

      • setPattern

        public final void setPattern(String pattern)
        A format string. When provided, all other options are ignored, except negativeColor. The format string is a subset of the ICU pattern set.
        Parameters:
        pattern -

      • setPrefix

        public final void setPrefix(String prefix)
        A string prefix for the value, for example "$".
        Parameters:
        prefix -

      • setSuffix

        public final void setSuffix(String suffix)
        A string suffix for the value, for example "%".
        Parameters:
        suffix -
